Key Match Events: England earned a nerve-shredding 20-run win over New Zealand to reignite their hopes in the Men’s T20 World Cup in Australia.
Ben Stokes provided the crucial breakthrough by dismissing Kane Williamson for 40 from 40 balls.
Sam Curran had Glenn Phillips caught at long-on for 62 from 36 balls to end New Zealand’s bid.
Jos Buttler hit 73 from 47 balls to lift his side to 179-6.
Jos Buttler and Alex Hales put on 81 for the opening wicket, with Hales making 52 from 40 balls.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England will qualify for the semi-finals if they beat Sri Lanka on Saturday, as long as Australia do not beat Afghanistan a day earlier and also overturn England’s significant net run-rate advantage.
The fact England’s match comes 24 hours after Australia helps their cause as they will have a clear picture of any net run-rate requirements going into their final game.
